block.p: A police captain has been arrested for the second time in just over two months on charges of assaulting a 32-year-old woman with whom he had a relationship, the police said.

The man, Capt. Alberto Sanchez, 41, was arrested Friday after the woman, whom the authorities did not identify, reported to the police that he assaulted her on Sept. 2 after an argument at a party on the Lower East Side. The police did not provide additional details but said that the woman declined to press charges at the time.

The man, Capt. Alberto Sanchez, 41, was arrested Friday after the woman, whom the authorities did not identify, reported to the police that he assaulted her on Sept. 2 after an argument at a party on the Lower East Side. The police did not provide additional details but said that the woman declined to press charges at the time.
Captain Sanchez, of Patrol Borough Queens North, has been suspended without pay for 30 days, a police spokesman said.

Captain Sanchez was arrested on Dec. 3 in another assault on the same woman. At the time he was the commander of the Police Cadet Corps, a two-year apprenticeship program for college students who are being encouraged to join the Police Department. He was later transferred.

He was accused in the December case of hitting the woman at a parking lot in the Bronx after she tried to break up with him, bruising her on the right eye, arm and leg, the police said. He was given a desk-appearance ticket and suspended without pay for 30 days, according to the police.
Captain Sanchez was charged with assault in both cases. He joined the force in January 1992 and was promoted to captain in 2003.
